channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Japan Says It Doctored Photo of Cabinet Ministers
item.description: The episode provided political fodder for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s critics and highlighted the country’s generally high standard of dress.

item.title: How to win the unfinished fight against cost-of-living shocks
item.description: The bottom line is that every government ought to be thinking about how to do better the next time.

item.title: Lead Drinking-Water Pipes Must be Replaced Nationwide, E.P.A. Says
item.description: The “historic” rule aims to eliminate a major source of lead poisoning and comes a decade after a drinking-water crisis in Flint, Mich.

item.title: China Stocks Surge After Government Measures to Boost Economy
item.description: The government has fired up investors by encouraging banks to lend more to buyers of stocks and real estate, but officials refrained on Tuesday from p...

item.title: After a Betrayal, a Fractured Cartel Turns Its Hometown Into a War Zone
item.description: An explosive deception has ripped apart one of Mexico’s most powerful criminal groups, the Sinaloa cartel, and ignited a war between the rival faction...

item.title: Hurricane Milton Is a Storm for the Record Books. Here’s What May Come Next.
item.description: The storm rapidly intensified on Monday.

item.title: More rich people are using ‘secret’ trusts and LLCs to hide money from their spouses
item.description: Secret trusts and LLCs are increasingly common ways wealthy people are shielding assets in divorce.

item.title: For Many Israelis, Oct. 7 Never Ended
item.description: The Hamas-led attacks that day shattered Israelis’ faith in the state, and the year of war that followed has deepened society’s divisions. Yet many fi...

item.title: Israel Mounts Heavy Attack on Southern Lebanon
item.description: After days of attacks there, Israel carried out further strikes in Lebanon and said it was sending more troops to fight Hezbollah. It also struck in G...

item.title: Spotify’s HR chief says remote staff aren’t ‘children’ as company reaffirms work-from-anywhere policy
item.description: Spotify isn't planning to follow Amazon and scrap its "work from anywhere" policy, but its HR chief admitted remote work isn't ideal.

item.title: China markets start like a lion and end like a lamb after Beijing stimulus comes up short
item.description: Shares in mainland China soared at the opening, as markets reopened after the Golden Week holidays. But they slid back as the stimulus plans provided ...

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded to 2 Scientists for Work on Machine Learning
item.description: John J. Hopfield and Geoffrey E. Hinton have “showed a completely new way for us to use computers to aid and to guide us” in solving problems, the com...

item.title: CBS Rebukes Anchor Over Tense Interview With Ta-Nehisi Coates
item.description: Executives said the interview, conducted by the morning show anchor Tony Dokoupil, had fallen short of network editorial standards.

item.title: After a Betrayal, a Fractured Cartel Turns Its Hometown Into a War Zone

item.title: Why embracing regret is the best decision you can make in the age of ‘radical uncertainty’
item.description: 68% of people say they are finding it hard to plan for the future.
